subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unit testing Contexts
msgSnippet: ... Do follow Kawai-san s advice. I would like to write a second edition only to correct all those kinds of mistakes--like using EasyMock instead of JMock. (At
messageBody:
Shinobu Kawai wrote:

> That's a very good book. I'm thinking of taking it to work today.
>
> In the book, the Velocity examples use the static methods in the
> Velocity class, but you should use new VelocityEngine instances in
> each of your tests instead. I think this is mentioned in some web
> page...

Do follow Kawai-san's advice. I would like to write a second edition
only to correct all those kinds of mistakes--like using EasyMock instead
of JMock. (At least I mentioned JMock at one point.)
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
